head.title: translates to: Live LifeViva la Vida

lg.l: I used to rule the world
Seas would rise when I gave the wordBiblical reference, to Moses parting the sea, shows the power he once had
Now in the morning, I sleep alone
Sweep the streets I used to ownShows his downfall from power, stating he now does low class job and is alone
I used to roll the dice
Feel the fear in my enemy's eyes
Listen as the crowd would sing
"Now the old king is dead, long live the king"In reference to old Europe when Monarchy's ruled, the narrator reminisces his time in power
One minute, I held the keyShows that the narrator once held, "the key to the city", representing his power. Though to him the time flew by, as he references, that he had it for one minute.
Next, the walls were closed on me
And I discovered that my castles stand

Upon pillars of salt and pillars of sandA biblical reference to the parable of the man who built his house on stone and the man who built is house on sand. The man who built is house on sand, is one who listens and does not act, which will hurt them in time. The narrator recognizes this looking back onto his life.
I hear Jerusalem bells a-ringin'

Roman cavalry choirs are singin'In the narrator downfall he tries to paint himself as someone who is unjustly going through this, comparing himself to Jesus. As Jesus was arrested in Jerusalem, by the Roman army.

Be my mirror, my sword and shieldThe narrator wishes that someone will carry on his legacy, in hopes that he can live vicariously through someone else. The mirror represents the reflection of himself, hoping someone sees themselves as him. The narrator is asking someone to fight for him, when referencing "my sword". Similarly, he is asking someone to protect his legacy, in referencing to "shield".
My missionaries in a foreign fieldThe narrator shows that he had great reach in the world imposing his beliefs on others
For some reason, I can't explain
Once you'd gone, there was never
Never an honest word

And that was when I ruled the worldThe narrator seemed to have lost someone close to him that advised him throughout his rule. After the advisors death, the narrator felt there was no one else he could trust. The people around him and himself constantly lied, all in hopes of having power.
It was a wicked and wild wind
Blew down the doors to let me inThe narrator recognizes that the way he took power was not ethical, describing it as "wicked".
Shattered windows and the sound of drums
People couldn't believe what I'd becomeThe power the narrator held corrupted who he once was, and turned him into a leader the people despised.
Revolutionaries wait

For my head on a silver plateThis symbolically represents the people wanting to overthrow the narrator, as he became very power hungry. This could relate to the many former monarchs that got beheaded.
Just a puppet on a lonely string (Mmm, mmm)
Aw, who would ever wanna be king?The narrator here is referencing the trouble that is with being a King. The trouble of keeping people happy, essentially turns you into a puppet of others.
I hear Jerusalem bells a-ringin'
Roman cavalry choirs are singin'
Be my mirror, my sword and shield
My missionaries in a foreign field
For some reason, I can't explain

I know Saint Peter won't call my nameAnother Biblical reference, as Saint Peter is said to be at the gates to Heaven, who lets people in. The narrator recognizes that his life has been one of greed, dishonesty and violence, which he believes will prevent him from going to Heaven.
Never an honest word
But that was when I ruled the world
Come up to meet you, tell you I'm sorry
You don't know how lovely you areThe narrator looks back at past mistakes he made in a relationship, hoping he can make up for them.
I had to find you, tell you I need you
Tell you I set you apart
Tell me your secrets and ask me your questionsExplaining to her what he will do to fix his mishaps. Recognizes that he did not listen to her in the past, in the last line.
Oh, let's go back to the startWishes he retract and start over again
Running in circles, coming up tails
Heads on a science apartTheir relationship keeps ending up in the same place, and they recognize that it is due to making the same mistakes. (Runnning in circles)
Nobody said it was easy
It's such a shame for us to partRecognize that the relationship is not working out, and is having a hard time moving on
Nobody said it was easy
No one ever said it would be this hard
Oh, take me back to the start
I was just guessing at numbers and figures

Pulling the puzzles apartWhile in the relationship he was figuring it out on the fly and was struggling. The narrator seems to recognize that he made many mistakes in the past, as he did not think through the many decisions he made, just guessed.
Questions of science, science and progress
Do not speak as loud as my heartRealizes that love is not a science and has to come from a greater feeling. One is not able to calculate the perfect relationship, as it is not a logical thing.
But tell me you love me, come back and haunt me
Oh and I rush to the start
Running in circles, chasing our tails
Coming back as we are
Nobody said it was easy
Oh, it's such a shame for us to part
Nobody said it was easy
No one ever said it would be so hard
I'm going back to the start
